citeinfo.origin: US Fish and Wildlife Service, Region 5, National Wildlife Refuge System, Realty Division, Land Surveying & Geospatial Services Branch
citeinfo.title: Assabet River National Wildlife Refuge

descript.abstract: National Wildlife Refuges are federal lands managed by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS). The primary source for boundary information is the USFWS Realty program (status maps, legal surveys). An effort by the USFWS Region 5 (northeast states - ME, NH, VT, MA, RI, CT, NY, PA, NJ, MD, DE, WV, VA) Realty Division, Cartography and Spatial Data Services Branch has resulted in digital refuge boundaries for all refuges in the Northeast at a scale of 1:24,000.
descript.purpose: The intended application of the refuge boundary data is for use as a spatial reference with other data layers in GIS and mapping applications. It is specifically not intended to be used as a land survey or representation of land for conveyance or tax purposes. For survey data, please contact USFWS, Region 5, Realty Division, Surveys Branch.

idinfo.useconst: Refuge boundary data were compiled for use with natural resource mapping and GIS applications. It is inappropriate to use these data in legal situations, or other applications where spatial error cannot exceed the USGS 7.5-minute mapping standards.

cntperp.cntorg: US Fish and Wildlife Service, Region 5, National Wildlife Refuge System, Realty Division, Land Surveying & Geospatial Services Branch

cntaddr.address: US Fish and Wildlife Service, Realty Division, 300 Westgate Center Dr.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

attracc.attraccr: Digital refuge boundaries are plotted with arc and polygon attributes, then compared to USFWS Realty status maps, survey documents, and collateral information for coding accuracy. Up to three levels of quality-control review are conducted (Cartography and Spatial Data Services Branch, Realty Management Branch, Refuge System Staff) with corrections being incorporated after each review until the dataset is deemed acceptable. See "Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) 97-01, United States Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS) Lands Boundary Data (Last Revision: January 15, 1998)" at http://www.fws.gov/stand/standards/pr_bndry.html.

dataqual.logic: Polygons are closed and adjusted to the most accurate geographic features, usually on a USGS 7.5' topographic quad. Dangling arcs, undershoots, and overshoots have been removed.
dataqual.complete: Boundaries were digitized for USFWS owned lands, lands where USFWS maintains a management interest, and areas approved for USFWS acquisition. Plots are generated and quality-control reviewed for omission and commission errors.

horizpa.horizpar: Digital refuge boundaries are verified against USGS 1:24,000-scale Digital Raster Graphics (DRGs) or 1:12,000-scale Digital Orthophoto Quarter Quads (DOQQs). Data are stored in ArcInfo double precision.

citeinfo.origin: USFWS, Region 5, National Wildlife Refuge System, Realty Division, Cartography and Spatial Data Services Branch
citeinfo.title: Assabet River NWR Status Map

procstep.procdesc: Status maps were registered to geographic coordinates, boundaries were digitized and attributed July 1995. Digital files were updated using survey and collateral data for newly acquired tracts, then stepped through 3 levels of quality-control review for spatial and attribute accuracy. Refuge boundary and tract lines were registered to USGS 1:24,000-scale DRGs: Maynard (1987). Complete process description can be found in "SOP 97-01, USFWS Lands Boundary Data (Last Revision: January 15, 1998)".

enttyp.enttypd: US Fish & Wildlife Service Interest - Nature of land ownership relative to the National Wildlife Refuge System.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Complex Name - Name of a number of stations combined under one management structure

attrdomv.udom: Regional National Wildlife Refuge complex list

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Organization Name - Official name given to a Service organization that has been assigned an official five-digit numeric organization code by the Washington Office, Division of Financial Management
attr.attrdefs: USFWS Data Element Standard for Organization Name

attrdomv.udom: Master List of Official Names for FWS Land Units

attr.attrdef: Division Name - Name given to a Service organization division

attrdomv.udom: Regional National Wildlife Refuge division list

attr.attrdef: Unit Name - Name given to a Service unit of a specific National Wildlife Refuge

attrdomv.udom: Regional National Wildlife Refuge unit list

attr.attrdef: Subunit Name - Name given to a Service subunit of a specific National Wildlife Refuge

attrdomv.udom: Regional National Wildlife Refuge subunit list

attr.attrdef: Organization Code - Unique five-digit numeric codes assigned by the Washington Office, Division of Financial Management, to Service organizations where personnel are assigned and all unstaffed land management units. Organization codes may also be assigned to meet an administrative requirement.

codesetd.codesetn: Master List of Organization Codes for FWS Land Units

attr.attrdef: The ORGCODE that reflects the actual managing station of a particular Service unit of the NWRS.

codesetd.codesetn: Master List of Organization Codes for FWS Land Units

attr.attrdef: Interior-USFWS number: unique 1-6 character code assigned by the Washington Office, Division of Realty, to each organizational unit, area, or project site over which the Service has some type of jurisdiction.
attr.attrdefs: USFWS Data Element Standard for IFWS Number

codesetd.codesetn: Master List of IFWS Numbers for FWS Land Units

attr.attrdef: Literals - Unique alpha codes assigned by the Washington Office, Division of Realty, that identify the organizational units, areas, and project sites on Service-owned lands.
attr.attrdefs: USFWS Data Element Standard for Literals

codesetd.codesetn: Master List of Literal Codes for FWS Land Units

attr.attrdef: Geographic Information System Acres - Acres determined by GIS software for each polygon

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Document Acres - Acres indicated in deed or other official document

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are derived from deed or other official document.

attr.attrdef: The current status of USFWS management pertaining to a parcel of a land or water, and whether the parcel is owned and/or managed by the USFWS (Acquired) or is owned and/or managed by another party (Inholding).

edom.edomvd: Acquired - Parcel for which FWS has fee or less than fee interest.
Inholding - Lands within the approved acquisition boundary for which the FWS has yet to acquire an interest.

attr.attrdef: Survey Acres - Acres determined by survey

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are derived from survey document.

attr.attrdef: Interest Type 1 - the primary real property interest (land or water) held by the USFWS.

edom.edomvd: Easement - area of land where USFWS shares interest via easement or lease
Secondary - area of land where USFWS holds secondary interest to another federal agency (ies)
Uncertain - status of parcel is uncertain because it is unknown or requires additional research
Life Use Reservation - An estate in property, the duration of which is confined to the life of one or more persons or contingent upon certain happenings.
Partial Interest - A shared ownership in a tract of land, between the Service and others.
Agreement - A written concurrence between USFWS and another party(ies) for management of a parcel of land or water.
Lease - Management of land and/or water is given by the owner to the USFWS for a specified period of time.
Fee - Lands owned in Fee by the United States where the Service is the primary administering agency.

attr.attrdef: Tract Number - Number assigned to each tract

attrdomv.udom: Unique numeric and alpha codes generated for each tract by USFWS Realty

attr.attrdef: Interest Type 2 - The secondary real property interest (land or water) held by the FWS.

edom.edomvd: Timber in exchange for FWS receiving title to land
Land in exchange for FWS receiving title to land

attr.attrdef: Comments - Additional information

attrdomv.udom: Unique note for each tract when necessary.

attr.attrdef: FWS Region - Regional offices within the Service that have responsibility for program and/or administrative activities within a geographically-defined area

edom.edomv: Great Lakes - Big Rivers Region or "3"
edom.edomvd: Great Lakes - Big Rivers Region, Region 3
Pacific Southwest Region (California and Nevada), Region 8

attr.attrdef: Interest Identification Number - A concatenation of IFWS and TRACTNO that includes a period (.) separator

attrdomv.udom: Unique string derived by concatinating the IFWS and TRACTNO fields.

attr.attrdef: Organization Type - Administrative categories that identify Service organizations by their primary facility function, program activities, specialized duties and responsibilities, and/or operational status.
attr.attrdefs: USFWS Data Element Standard for Organization Type

overview.eaover: Refuge boundaries define areas that are approved for acquisition into the National Wildlife Refuge System or are currently owned by USFWS. Arcs are coded with an item "boundary" with the type of boundary line; polygons are coded with an item "status" that describes their ownership status. See "SOP 97-01, USFWS Lands Boundary Data (Last Revision: January 15, 1998)"
overview.eadetcit: See "SOP 97-01, USFWS Lands Boundary Data (Last Revision: January 15, 1998)"

distinfo.distliab: Although these data and information have been processed successfully on a computer system at the USFWS, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data and information on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data, and information, and aggregate use with other data and information. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data and information. The USFWS shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data and information described and/or contained herein.
